item.title: Report E-2024070483
item.description:
Report E-2024070483

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSJ experienced a UN1993 Unisol Liquid Red BK 50 release from a 330-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor and tote body due to a broken gasket. The crew retrieved a new gasket and repaired the tote for shipment on. The impacted areas were cleaned and wiped down with absorbent pads. All waste was placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024070465
item.description:
Report E-2024070465

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a pin sized puncture. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and containerized the spent absorbents into one (1) 5-gallon metal pail. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070458
item.description:
Report E-2024070458

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: ST PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) cup of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a loose lid. The lid was replaced, and the container was shipped on to the consignee. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel stated that the released material was dried and therefore no cleanup was completed. No waste was generated.

item.title: Report X-2024071165
item.description:
Report X-2024071165

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDEDED TO LEAKER AT DOOR 18 WITH ALL PPE FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE FOLLOWED THE PROCEDURE THE PACKAGE WAS SITTING UPRIGHT IN THE TRAILER WITH SMALL WET SPOT IN BOTTOM CORNER OF THE BOX THERE WAS NO OTHER VISIBLE DAMAGE. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN CLEANED UP, NO PUDDLE EXISTED ON FLOOR. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP WHERE IT WAS REFRENCED IN ETT AND OPERATORS QUICK REFERENCE GUIDE. THE PACKAGE WAS NEUTRALIZED WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE AND THEN ABSORBED WITH ZEP ZORBANT.

item.title: Report E-2024070414
item.description:
Report E-2024070414

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that three (3) quarts of material was released due to the boxes being crushed during transit. HEPACO personnel verified four (4) boxes were damaged. HEPACO deployed oil dri and swept up the released material. The damaged product and recovered material was placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.
